DBD is an addictive 4 vs 1 survival-horror game that really immerses you in the role of the survivor or killer. It is best enjoyed with friends when playing as a survivor, but is also fun to play solo as a killer (although with occasionally long queue times).

If you are into horror, you need this. It provides an incredibly built horror challenge that captures the feel very well without feeling hopeless. But know what you sign up for. On both sides, this game is tough. This is not for people with a rage-quit attitude. This game requires dedicated teamwork, sacrifice, and not giving up till the very end. As someone who has been a horror junkie for years, I absolutely love this game. Know going in that sometimes you get matched up with someone not as good, or with someone much better. It is going to happen. Do your best, learn, and don't give up. Know there will be rage-quit pansies who don't know how to handle the slightest bit of challenge. Don't be discouraged. You're in a horror game. FIGHT TO SURVIVE. As the killer, enjoy the hunt. This game is not about the most efficient kills. This game is about the terror. Accomplish your objectives, but make it frightening. Enjoy spreading fear and worry. Savor it and let it last. I really hope this game keeps up and that someday, there is a sequel. I look forward to buying more DLC, and I thank the devs for the amazing game they've brought us. I can't stop playing.
Great game, would highly recommend to anyone who enjoys horror survival and pvp genres. Isn't perfect, but its glitches and issues are outweighed by the extremely fun and stressful gameplay. Buy it.
Would Recommend to anyone who likes to Have a good Game with friends!
alto juegardo, si quieren jugar mejor vean al menostrece

After playing for 125 hours, I can now say that this game is very innovative. It includes common things that people may know from other platforms, such as the Stranger Things bundle from Netflix. Dead By Daylight is very fun to play, whether it is with friends or by yourself. Though, while playing solo, there are many issues. The communication is obviously whack because there are little ways you can communicate, such as using the "point" option and the "follow me" option. This can affect how the game play is a little bit, but there shouldn't be any reason to dislike it. Sometimes the matchmaking system is pretty messed up as well, such as a rank 10 player playing with a rank 1. Asides that, it is pretty smooth and a very great game.

Back in 2019 when i started playing dbd the game was actually fun, but now i'm editing my review and i want to give 3 reasons for new players to not play this game at all after 6k hours on 2 different accounts.

MMR - Since "MMR" came out, soloq as survivor is impossible to play because killers or the majority of them tend to tunnel someone out of the game ASAP and that is literally not fun for survivors that play solo as myself. As a killer main i understand that you need to do that against a sweaty 4man swf on comms with the 4 mambo jambo and that is not fun, they literally join the server, do 5 gens in 4 min and they don't even interact with the killer and that basically are the "Top MMR games" so it's a lot of fun for sure.


BOONS - Legit the worst mechanic BHVR came with. We already had ranger medickits, bottany and will make it and BHVR decide to put the game even more survivor sided by creating self-care in a toten. Even after the nerfs, it's still an OP perk in every scenario, if someone heals you, it's still faster than using self-care. To not mention the shadow-step one that in some maps combined with Iron Will, well good luck tracking people if your tracking as killer is not that good.


TOXICITY - After playing basically 3 years of DBD and i'm gonna say this by my experience of course, most of my end-game chat experiences were very toxic! I don't think people know how to win/lose on videogames and they take DBD 2 seriously that so they say random toxic stuff to people that they just faced for the first time for 15 minutes. Rare were the cases that i had people showing sportmanship and saying gg even me playing as killer and tunneling or camping because i had to, not because i enjoy that playstyle i really don't, but sometimes you gotta do it. Because of the previous i disabled my end-game chat from now on.


Ultimately the game is still fun, but i don't really recommend it for new players, especially if you're thinking playing killer, you gonna have a hard time when you get to "High MMR" and it's not worth it, there's so many more options on the table.

Cheers!

Lets start off by saying this game is very unique in design!
Its a cat and mouse style game where you have the survivors trying to escape the killer and the killer.. well... trying to kill them. 
I love the killer variety and their different abilities and the survivors also have lots of fun perks for spicing up gameplay.

I will say that this game has a high skill curve right off the bat as the mechanics are not something you will be familiar with, but once you understand the concepts of 'looping' and using pallets you will quickly understand what the game is really about (absolutely annihilating the killers mental) or (rag dolling survivors with your pretty pink skull).

No but really this game is very very fun and simply requires a bit of time and experience to begin to appreciate it, you won't find anything like it.

It does however have its negatives, such as the occasional annoying bug they take 2 weeks to patch, toxic behaviours and attitudes of players (you'll know what I mean, trust), and over tuned perks on both sides.

Despite this, all in all DBD is a great game!

With over 450 hours on the game i can confidently say that this is one of the most fun games i have ever played. While it can be tricky to learn at first once you start to get the hang of the game's mechanics it is a really enjoyable experience, especially with other people to play it with.
A fun game either playing with friends or against them, it's a fine game taking a break from FPS games.

I love this games concept. It's all about decisions, mindgames and strategy. This game has the potential to be a timeless classic, but the developers of this game aren't allowing this to happen. For many months now, harmful changes and features have been added to the game against multiple community outcries. The lack of communication has been getting more and more severe and each update seemed to be worse than before. Even though I like this game, I don't really see a future for it so I can't recommend it to new players.
